free_text.Learning outcomes: To present fundamentals in Chemical Reaction Engineering allowing the proper choice, design and exploitation of a chemical reactor at lab, pilot or industrial scale. [br/]
free_text.Content: [b]1. Introduction[/b][br/][li] The reactor as part of the process[br/][li] Parameter estimation and production costs[br/][li] Definitions, balances, stoechiometry[br/][li] thermodynamics and chemical kinetics[br/][br/][b]2. Ideal (quasi) homogeneous reactors[/b][br/][li] Material and energy balances[br/][li] Closed reaction systems (batch reactors)[br/][li] Continuous flow stirred tank reactor (CSTR)[br/][li] Plug flow reactor[br/][br/][b]3. Choice of the reactor and  optimisation of the reactor performance[/b][br/][li] Simple reaction, optimisation of the conversion[br/][li] Complex reactions: optimisation of yield and selectivity[br/][li] Combination of ideal reactors[br/][br/][br/][br/][b]4. Real quasi homogeneous reactors[/b][br/][li] residence time distribution (RTD)[br/][li] experimental determination of RTD[br/][li] RTD in ideal reactors[br/]

free_text.Remarque: Enseignement partiel du module Génie chimique
free_text.Prérequis: Le cours nécessite les connaissances de: "Introduction au génie chimique", "Cinétique", "Thermodynamique chimique", "Transfert de masse et de chaleur"

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Donner aux étudiants les bases dans le Génie de réactions chimiques pour le choix, le dimensionnement et l'exploitation des réacteurs à l'échelle de l'industrie, des laboratoires et des unités pilotes.
